instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid damage.

Same issue on clients macOS, Bootcamp and on mine external macOS.
No audio.

In system preferences > Sound Output and Input shows 'No devices found"
On touchbar volume buttons are grayed out.

Headphones not detected when plugged in.

<CHIP>U6400</CHIP>/40 and <CHIP>U6500</CHIP>/50 got power rails present.
<SIGNAL>AUD_SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> got only 0.01V

<RESISTOR>R6401</RESISTOR> got correct resistnace.

<CHIP>U6200</CHIP> got power rails present
<SIGNAL>AUD_CODEC_INT_L</SIGNAL> 1.8V
<SIGNAL>AUD_SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> 1.8V
<SIGNAL>SPK_IDO</SIGNAL> 1.8V

Any idea?

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message:
Removed <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and all pads are connected with rest of the board, no broken lines.
Replaced <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> but issue still the same.

Any hope?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: If reset is OK and all series resistors too, then should be PCH issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: OK, thank you for help anyway :)
